alert.note: Alert for Bell; Falls; Limestone; McLennan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 9:32PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern McLennan, northeastern Bell, southern Limestone and Falls Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 931 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Moody to Marlin to Lorena. Movement was south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Temple, Hewitt, Robinson, Marlin, Groesbeck, Lorena, Troy, Bruceville-Eddy, Moody, Riesel, Lott, Golinda, Lake Limestone, Lake Creek Lake, Chilton, Thornton, Kosse, White Hall, Fallon and Mooreville. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 295 and 325. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
